alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:47PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Converse County through 845 PM MDT... At 747 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Laprele Reservoir, or 7 miles west of Douglas, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Douglas around 805 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 136 and 151. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
